note: Monetary poverty data is measured in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices to account for inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita).
title: CO₂ emissions per capita vs. share in extreme poverty
subtitle: Average CO₂ emissions per capita are measured in tonnes per year. Extreme poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day.
